metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7100 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the unpacksms16 function in apps/app_sms.c in Asterisk Open Source 1.8.x before 1.8.24.1, 10.x before 10.12.4, and 11.x before 11.6.1; Asterisk with Digiumphones 10.x-digiumphones before 10.12.4-digiumphones; and Certified Asterisk 1.8.x before 1.8.15-cert4 and 11.x before 11.2-cert3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a 16-bit SMS message with an odd number of bytes, which triggers an infinite loop.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7100` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:11.7.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
